meanings.definition: As a result or effect of something else.
meanings.sent1: She forgot her umbrella and consequently got soaked in the rain.
meanings.sent2: He missed the bus and consequently arrived late to work.
meanings.sent3: The cat knocked over the vase, and consequently, the dog got blamed for it.
meanings.sent4: The broken lock on the door consequently led to a burglary.
meanings.sent5: The leak in the roof consequently caused water damage to the ceiling.

meanings.sent1: She didn't study for the test; consequently, she failed.
meanings.sent2: He didn't have enough money; consequently, he couldn't buy the new shoes.
meanings.sent3: The bakery ran out of bread; consequently, the customers had to go elsewhere.
meanings.sent4: The car ran out of gas; consequently, they had to walk home.
meanings.sent5: The power outage lasted for hours; consequently, the food in the fridge spoiled.
